alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Logan; Sherman; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 22 at 4:30AM CDT until March 22 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT /1 PM CDT/ TODAY TO 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 013, 027, 028, 041, 042, 253, AND 254... * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Timing...Noon MDT (1 PM CDT) through 8 PM MDT (9 PM CDT). * Winds...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 17 percent. * Temperatures...In the upper 60s to middle 70s. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. Blowing dust is also expected and could create delays in response time of first responders due to limited visibility. Gusty west winds are expected this evening, shifting to the north and decreasing in speed after midnight across the Red Flag Warning area.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
